page.title: 13GEOGRAPHY AND ECOLOGY
page.content: Yatton is situated along a slight ridge rising above the surrounding low-lying meadowland.Before drainage schemes were introduced these areas were subject to flooding and sometimes incursions by the sea.Because of drainage problems most of the surrounding farmland is used for dairy cattle or growing hay.To the south of Yatton the small river Yeo meanders its way to the sea . To the north,an area known as the Moors is a haven for wetlands flora and fauna-wild iris, lapwings, herons and small wading birds. At the south-east of the village lies Cadbury Hill.Owned by Yatton and Congresbury parish councils this prehistoric hillfort is notable for its rare plants and butterflies.A former quarry has been used for dumping rubbish.
